list.description:
additional CLI commands to append to the generated Junos config

**Note**: no check is done

int64.description:
when bfd_multiplier is configured alone. Default:
  * 1000 if `type`==`external`
  * 350 `type`==`internal`
when bfd_minimum_interval_is_configured alone

bool.description: BFD provides faster path failure detection and is enabled by default

string.description: default export policies if no per-neighbor policies defined

bool.description:
by default, either inet/net6 unicast depending on neighbor IP family (v4 or v6)
for v6 neighbors, to exchange v4 nexthop, which allows dual-stack support, enable this

int64.description: `0` means disable

string.description: default import policies if no per-neighbor policies defined

bool.description: If true, the BGP session to this neighbor will be administratively disabled/shutdown

int64.description: assuming BGP neighbor is directly connected

map_nested.description: if per-neighbor as is desired. Property key is the neighbor address

list.description: if `type`!=`external`or `via`==`wan`networks where we expect BGP neighbor to connect to/from

bool.description: by default, we'll re-advertise all learned BGP routers toward overlay

list.description: if `type`==`local` or `type6`==`local` - optional, if not defined, system one will be used
if `type`==`local` or `type6`==`local` - optional, if not defined, system one will be used

map_nested.description: if `type`==`local` or `type6`==`local`. Property key is the MAC Address. Format is `[0-9a-f]{12}` (e.g "5684dae9ac8b")

string.description: if `type`==`local` - optional, `ip` will be used if not provided

int64.description: in seconds, lease time has to be between 3600 [1hr] - 604800 [1 week], default is 86400 [1 day]

map_nested.description: if `type`==`local` or `type6`==`local`. Property key is the DHCP option number

bool.description:
`server_id_override`==`true` means the device, when acts as DHCP relay and forwards DHCP responses from DHCP server to clients, 
should overwrite the Sever Identifier option (i.e. DHCP option 54) in DHCP responses with its own IP address.

list.description: if `type`==`relay`
if `type6`==`relay`

map_nested.description:
if `type`==`local` or `type6`==`local`. Property key is <enterprise number>:<sub option code>, with
  * enterprise number: 1-65535 (https://www.iana.org/assignments/enterprise-numbers/enterprise-numbers)
  * sub option code: 1-255, sub-option code'
Property key is the network name

bool.description: if set to `false`, disable the DHCP server

list.description: Global dns settings. To keep compatibility, dns settings in `ip_config` and `oob_ip_config` will overwrite this setting
Global dns settings. To keep compatibility, dns settings in `ip_config` and `oob_ip_config` will overwrite this setting

map_nested.description: Property key is the destination CIDR (e.g. "10.0.0.0/8")
Property key is the destination CIDR (e.g. "2a02:1234:420a:10c9::/64")

string.description: Unique ID of the object instance in the Mist Organnization

enum:
  * alert (default)
  * drop: siliently dropping packets
  * close: notify client/server to close connection

map_nested.description: Property key is the profile name

list.description: optional list of secondary IPs in CIDR format

map_nested.description: Property key is the network name

bool.description: whether to disallow Mist Devices in the network

map_nested.description: Property key may be an IP/Port (i.e. "63.16.0.3:443"), or a port (i.e. ":2222")

bool.description: by default, all access is allowed, to only allow certain traffic, make `restricted`=`true` and define service_policies

string.description: If not set, we configure the nat policies against all WAN ports for simplicity

map_nested.description: Property key may be an IP Address (i.e. "172.16.0.1"), and IP Address and Port (i.e. "172.16.0.1:8443") or a CIDR (i.e. "172.16.0.12/20")

single_nested.description: whether this network has direct internet access

bool.description: whether to allow clients in the network to talk to each other
if the network will only be the soruce of the multicast traffic, IGMP can be disabled

map_nested.description: Group address to RP (rendezvous point) mapping. Property Key is the CIDR (example "225.1.0.3/32")

single_nested.description: whether to enable multicast support (only PIM-sparse mode is supported)

list.description: for a Network (usually LAN), it can be routable to other networks (e.g. OSPF)

string.description: if `routed`==`true`, whether to advertise an aggregated subnet toward HUB this is useful when there are multiple networks on SPOKE's side

bool.description: whether to allow ping from vpn into this routed network

map_nested.description: Property key may be an IP/Port (i.e. "63.16.0.3:443"), or a port (i.e. ":2222")

string.description: if `routed`==`false` (usually at Spoke), but some hosts needs to be reachable from Hub, a subnet is required to create and advertise the route to Hub

bool.description: toward LAN-side BGP peers
toward LAN-side OSPF peers

toward overlay
how HUB should deal with routes it received from Spokes

list.description:
by default, the routes are only readvertised toward the same vrf on spoke
to allow it to be leaked to other vrfs

bool.description: whether this network is routable

single_nested.description: if `routed`==`false` (usually at Spoke), but some hosts needs to be reachable from Hub

string.description: If not set, we configure the nat policies against all WAN ports for simplicity

map_nested.description: Property key may be an IP Address (i.e. "172.16.0.1"), and IP Address and Port (i.e. "172.16.0.1:8443") or a CIDR (i.e. "172.16.0.12/20")

string.description:
toward overlay
how HUB should deal with routes it received from Spokes

map_nested.description: Property key is the VPN name. Whether this network can be accessed from vpn

list.description: list of NTP servers specific to this device. By default, those in Site Settings will be used

string.description: used only if `subnet` is not specified in `networks`

bool.description: if supported on the platform. If enabled, DNS will be using this routing-instance, too
whether to use `mgmt_junos` for host-out traffic (NTP/TACPLUS/RADIUS/SYSLOG/SNMP), if alternative source network/ip is desired

single_nested.description: for HA Cluster, node1 can have different IP Config

custom.schema_definition:
objectdefault.StaticValue(
  types.ObjectValueMust(
    Node1Value{}.AttributeTypes(ctx),
    map[string]attr.Value{
      "gateway":                   types.StringNull(),
      "ip":                        types.StringNull(),
      "netmask":                   types.StringNull(),
      "type":                      types.StringValue("dhcp"),
      "use_mgmt_vrf":              types.BoolNull(),
      "use_mgmt_vrf_for_host_out": types.BoolNull(),
      "vlan_id":                   types.StringNull(),
    },
  ),
)

bool.description: if supported on the platform. If enabled, DNS will be using this routing-instance, too
for host-out traffic (NTP/TACPLUS/RADIUS/SYSLOG/SNMP), if alternative source network/ip is desired

custom.schema_definition:
objectdefault.StaticValue(
  types.ObjectValueMust(
    OobIpConfigValue{}.AttributeTypes(ctx),
    map[string]attr.Value{
      "gateway":                   types.StringNull(),
      "ip":                        types.StringNull(),
      "netmask":                   types.StringNull(),
      "type":                      types.StringValue("dhcp"),
      "use_mgmt_vrf":              types.BoolNull(),
      "use_mgmt_vrf_for_host_out": types.BoolNull(),
      "vlan_id":                   types.StringNull(),
      "node1": types.ObjectValueMust(
        Node1Value{}.AttributeTypes(ctx),
        map[string]attr.Value{
          "gateway":                   types.StringNull(),
          "ip":                        types.StringNull(),
          "netmask":                   types.StringNull(),
          "type":                      types.StringValue("dhcp"),
          "use_mgmt_vrf":              types.BoolNull(),
          "use_mgmt_vrf_for_host_out": types.BoolNull(),
          "vlan_id":                   types.StringNull(),
        },
      ),
    },
  ),
)

bool.description: For SSR Only. `true`, if this specific path is undesired

string.description: only if `type`==`local`, if a different gateway is desired

bool.description: only if `type`==`vpn`, if this vpn path can be used for internet

string.description:
required when 
  * `type`==`vpn`: the name of the VPN Path to use 
  * `type`==`wan`: the name of the WAN interface to use'

list.description: required when `type`==`local`
if `type`==`local`, if destination IP is to be replaced

map_nested.description: Property key is the path name

bool.description: if `aggregated`==`true`. To disable LCP support for the AE interface

string.description: if `aggregated`==`true`. Users could force to use the designated AE name (must be an integer between 0 and 127)

bool.description:
For SRX Only, if `aggregated`==`true`.Sets the state of the interface as UP when the peer has limited LACP capability.\n
Use case: When a device connected to this AE port is ZTPing for the first time, it will not have LACP configured on the other end\n
Note: Turning this on will enable force-up on one of the interfaces in the bundle only
if want to generate port up/down alarm, set it to true
port admin up (true) / down (false)

int64.description:
if `wan_type`==`dsl`
16 bit int

if `wan_type`==`dsl`
8 bit int

list.description: except for out-of_band interface (vme/em0/fxp0)
except for out-of_band interface (vme/em0/fxp0)

string.description: used only if `subnet` is not specified in `networks`
optional, the network to be used for mgmt
name that we'll use to derive config

list.description: if `usage`==`lan`

int64.description: for Q-in-Q

bool.description: whether to preserve dscp when sending traffic over VPN (SSR-only)
if HA mode

int64.description: if HA mode

list.description: SSR only - supporting vlan-based redundancy (matching the size of `networks`)

bool.description: when SSR is running as VM, this is required on certain hosting platforms

list.description:
percentages for differet class of traffic: high / medium / low / best-effort
sum must be equal to 100

int64.description: if WAN interface is on a VLAN

bool.description: Only if the VPN `type`==`hub_spoke`. Whether to use tunnel mode. SSR only

int64.description: Only if the VPN `type`==`hub_spoke`. For a given VPN, when `path_selection.strategy`==`simple`, the preference for a path (lower is preferred)

list.description:
percentages for differet class of traffic: high / medium / low / best-effort
sum must be equal to 100

map_nested.description: Property key is the VPN name

string.description: optional, if spoke should reach this port by a different IP

map_nested.description: Property Key is the destianation CIDR (e.g "100.100.100.0/24")

bool.description: or to disable the source-nat

single_nested.description: optional, by default, source-NAT is performed on all WAN Ports using the interface-ip

map_nested.description: Property key is the port(s) name or range (e.g. "ge-0/0/0-10")

list.description: for SSR, hub decides how VRF routes are leaked on spoke
when used as export policy, optional
when used as export policy, optional. To exclude certain AS
when used as export policy, optional

string.description: optional, for an import policy, local_preference can be changed

list.description: when used as export policy, optional. By default, the local AS will be prepended, to change it
takes regular expression
zero or more criteria/filter can be specified to match the term, all criteria have to be met
`direct`, `bgp`, `osp`, ...

string.description:
name of the vrf instance
it can also be the name of the VPN or wan if they

list.description: overlay-facing criteria (used for bgp_config where via=vpn)

overlay-facing criteria (used for bgp_config where via=vpn)
ordered-

single_nested.description: zero or more criteria/filter can be specified to match the term, all criteria have to be met

list_nested.description: zero or more criteria/filter can be specified to match the term, all criteria have to be met

map_nested.description: Property key is the routing policy name

string.description: Required when `servicepolicy_id` is not defined, optional otherwise (override the servicepolicy action). enum: `allow`, `deny`
org_level IDP Profile can be used, this takes precedence over `profile`
enum: `Custom`, `strict` (default), `standard` or keys from from idp_profiles

bool.description: access within the same VRF

string.description: Required when `servicepolicy_id` is not defined, optional otherwise (override the servicepolicy name)

by default, we derive all paths available and use them
optionally, you can customize by using `path_preference`
used to link servicepolicy defined at org level and overwrite some attributes

list.description: Required when `servicepolicy_id` is not defined. List of Applications / Desctinations
Required when `servicepolicy_id` is not defined. List of Networks / Users
optional, only needed if `vars_only`==`false`
optional, only needed if `vars_only`==`false`

int64.description: Only if `provider`== `custom-ipsec`
if `provider`== `custom-ipsec`

string.description:
Only if `provider`== `custom-ipsec`. enum:
  * 1
  * 2 (1024-bit)
  * 5
  * 14 (default, 2048-bit)
  * 15 (3072-bit)
  * 16 (4096-bit)
  * 19 (256-bit ECP)
  * 20 (384-bit ECP)
  * 21 (521-bit ECP)
  * 24 (2048-bit ECP)

number of consecutive misses before declaring the tunnel down
